I believe the build failed because the corresponding fault log entry interface changes haven't been merged to phosphor-dbus-interfaces yet.

I believe the build failed because the corresponding fault log entry interface changes haven't been merged to phosphor-dbus-interfaces yet (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/53018/).

nit: can this happen at the very end of the while block? i.e. do this after `entry->delete_()`. It seems bug prone to do it this way because if there's any logic added to this block in the future, `iter` is already going to be the next item.
Good point, done.
Same comment as above
Done

The reasoning for this part isn't super clear to me just by reading the code. Why are we replacing the `std::chrono` time with the latest entry's timestamp + 1? What if the entry that we're calling `generateTimestamp()` for came much, much later than the latest entry in the map?

A comment to explain is probably a good idea to have.

Added an explanation and modified the code (I realized the previous code doesn't work correctly if accounting for user-initiated entry deletion). The important line is the if-statement before the increment. The increment is expected to be a rare case (e.g. more than one fault log entry created within the same microsecond, or BMC clock being set backwards.)
nit: This bool seems a bit redundant to have. Could do `entry->delete_()` and then return early here instead.
Done

Shouldn't `entry->delete_()` also be called here if the entry didn't have a valid type?

Also, doesn't `entry->delete_()` already do the erase from the parentmap? Doing it twice (line 474 and then line 479) would throw an exception when the key isn't found in the second try.
Good catches, thanks! (The second erase didn't throw an exception so I didn't notice the redundancy during testing.)

These two functions looks to me more like a platform specific implementation.
It is assuming that the crashdump is from objPath "/com/intel/crashdump" and cperLog is from objPath "/xyz/openbmc_project/external_storer/bios_bmc_smm_error_logger/CPER"
I think it would be good to have some design to extend the source of fault log for different platform or architecture easily.
Will work on it.
Would it be better to use helper functions sdbusplus::bus::match::rules::interfacesAdded() to read the code easily?
Yes, will fix.

The implementation assumes CPER log is at CPER_LOG_PATH but in createDump() is trying to open log file at FAULTLOG_DUMP_PATH.
Could it be problem if the two options are not the same path.

They are separate logs and are expected to be at different paths. Logs at CPER_LOG_PATH are written by another daemon which notifies the fault log manager here of a new log via an InterfacesAdded D-Bus signal. Currently logs at FAULTLOG_DUMP_PATH aren't really used, but they are owned by the fault log manager which could theoretically write additional fault info to them.
